column4: it's also not a good idea to take things too personally, in my experience.
assuming that Linux is going to work like Windows, and support the same feature set, and operate using the same principles, is a flawed assumption.
seth is right. the best bet is to tell us the task you want to accomplish, and let the Linux community point you to the best solution

did you install Cacti on the Ubuntu machine? if so, how? did you ensure all the dependencies were met? "Cacti requires MySQL, PHP, RRDTool, net-snmp, and a webserver that supports PHP such as Apache or IIS. Please see the requirements section of the manual for information on how to fulfill these requirements under certain operating systems. Please use the install guide for either Unix or Windows for information about installing Cacti."
it works fine with the windows boxs
it may surprise you to learn that Linux is not Windows

if i bought a box of tampons, inserted them into my urethra, and then went to the doctor and said, "but it *works for my girlfriend!" do you think he'd say, "you're absolutely right. these tamposn are flawed?"
the hell you talking about,
cacti is installed, i can view graphs on a windows server, i want to view graphs on a linux server
i'm talking about the fact that i asked you if you had installed the Linux dependencies for Cacti and your resaponse was, "it works in Windows."
i just want to know how to get that working
one last time. MySQL, PHP, RRDTool, net-snmp, and Apache. you installedf all those. on Ubuntu. and configured them.
Once again sudo apt-get install cacti
so now go configure the software
apt-get is not smart enough to edit your config files to set things up exactly how you want them.
cacti php all that other stuff working but when i go into cacti to setup a device it says my ubuntu box has a SNMP error
so find that exact error. write it down. go ask Cacti people how that issue is resolved.
lol its a snmp error
oh, right. i'm sure Cacti users have never heard of an SNMP error and would be unable to help you resolve SNMP errors with Cacti.
go talk to Cacti users. they actually use this product.
